title: R -AND OROperators

metadata.description: Learn about R -AND OROperators with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
AND
The
&
symbol (and) is a logical operator, and 
is used to combine conditional statements:
Example
Test if a is greater than b, AND if c is greater than a:
a <- 200
b <- 33
c <- 500
if (a > b & c > a) {
print("Both conditions are true")
}

OR
The
|
symbol (or) is a logical operator, and is used to combine conditional statements:
Example
Test if a is greater than b, or if c is greater than a:
a <- 200
b <- 33
c <- 500
if (a > b | a > c) {
print("At 
  least one of the conditions is true")
}

★
+1

content_sections.title: Example
Example
content_sections.code:
a <- 200
b <- 33
c <- 500
if (a > b | a > c) {
print("At 
  least one of the conditions is true")
}

summary: This tutorial covers R -AND OROperators concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use R -AND OROperators effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of R -AND OROperators and how to apply it in your projects.
